subject: Leadership
title: Learned Helplessness
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Learned Helplessness.

hook.text: An employee stops suggesting improvements. When asked why, she says 'Nothing ever changes.' She's given up trying.

buildup.text: Seligman: when people believe their actions wonâ€™t matter, they stop actingâ€”even when escape is possible.

discovery.text: In organizations, repeated ignored feedback creates helplessness. People learn that effort is pointless.

twist.text: Leaders cause helplessness without knowing it. Overriding decisions, ignoring input, and punishing risk teach passivity.

climax.text: Reverse it: give people small wins, act on their input visibly, and prove that effort leads to change. Rebuild agency.

punchline.text: People don't stop caring. They stop believing it matters.

quiz.question: What is learned helplessness?
options: Believing your actions won't change outcomes
